category: Herbs that Clear Heat and Purge Fire

action.primary: Clears Heat, relieves Fire toxicity and improves the throat

indications: Swollen, painful throat due to Fire Excess, Fire toxin or Phlegm-Heat obstruction
Can be used alone for sore throat

action.primary: Transforms Phlegm, clears the Lungs and eliminates wheezing

indications: Cough and wheezing with Phlegm obstruction, Lung-Heat asthma
Combined with warming herbs for Phlegm Obstruction due to Cold-Phlegm

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with loose stools or diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency Cold.
Do not use for an extended period of time.

useCases: Sore throat and coughing due to Lung Heat.
Pain and swelling of the throat with hoarseness due to Fire Excess.
Phlegm-Heat in the throat with a swollen, sore throat and Phlegm that is difficult to expectorate.
Cough, pain and swelling of the throat with difficulty expectorating due to Lung Heat.
Wind-Cold asthma with constriction of the chest as a result of Phlegm.
Dyspnea and cough with profuse yellow sputum.
Dyspnea and cough with profuse white or clear sputum.

notes: Some sources say that this herb descends Qi and disperses Blood.
It is used externally as a wash with a little salt to treat field dermatitis.

Both She Gan and Lasiosphere/Calvatia #{MaBo} Ma Bo clear Heat, benefit the throat, resolve toxicity, disperse clumped heat and are frequently used for swelling and pain of the throat. She Gan is bitter, cold, descends pathogenic Heat and transforms Phlegm. Ma Bo is lightweight and dispersing, acrid neutral, focuses on the Lungs and the Blood to treat epistaxis and treats swelling and pain of the throat due to Wind-Heat.
Dry-fried Belamcanda Chao She Gan is less cold and bitter and is appropriate for deficient patients who have a sore, swollen throat.

She Gan and Rx. Sophorae Tonkinensis #{ShanDouGen} Shan Dou Gen have similar actions of clearing Heat. She Gan is stronger at dispelling Phlegm and dispersing Stagnation, while Shan Dou Gen is stronger at sedating Fire.
